metadata.title: CVE-2021-31826 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Shibboleth Service Provider 3.x before 3.2.2 is prone to a NULL pointerdereference flaw involving the session recovery feature. The flaw isexploitable (for a daemon crash) on systems not using this feature if acrafted cookie is supplied.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-shib - 3.2.2+dfsg1-1
libshibsp-plugins - 3.2.2+dfsg1-1
libshibsp10 - 3.2.2+dfsg1-1
shibboleth-sp-common - 3.2.2+dfsg1-1
shibboleth-sp-utils - 3.2.2+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shibboleth-sp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.2+dfsg1-1').
